content:
ople by violating this natural assumption is shown in
the following passage from The Catcher in the Rye.
The new elevator boy was sort of on the stupid side. I told him, in this very
casual voice, to take me up the Dicksteins’....
He had the elevator doors all shut and all, and was all set to take me up, and
then he turned around and said, “They ain’t in. They’re at a party on the
fourteenth floor.”
“That’s all right,” I said. “I’m supposed to wait for them. I’m their nephew.”
He gave me this so
